intro: Chrysurus echinatus, commonly known as the spiny chrysurus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant's unique morphology and ecological preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
